title: Detective Trevor Joseph Series - Katherine John
description:
Katherine John is a pen name of the author Catrin Collier. She was born and brought up in Pontypridd and worked for a while in Europe and America before returning to her native Wales. She now lives on the Gower Peninsula near Swansea, with her family. 
 
DETECTIVE TREVOR JOSEPH SERIES 
 
Without Trace (Detective Trevor #1): So intriguing . . . cleverly woven together and tensely written - Sunday Times First book in the Detective Trevor Joseph series. In the chilly half-light of dawn a bizarre pierrot figure waits in the shadows of a deserted stretch of motorway. The costumed hitchhiker's victim is a passing motorist...

Midnight Murders (Detective Trevor #2): Compton Castle is a Victorian psychiatric hospital long overdue for demolition. Its warrens of rooms and acres of grounds, originally designed as a sanctuary for the mentally ill, now provide the ideal stalking ground for a serial killer...

Murder Of A Dead Man (Detective Trevor #3): Third book in the Detective Trevor Joseph series. Jubilee Street Ã¢â‚¬â€œ the haunt of addicts and vagrants is a part of town to avoid at all costs, especially when it becomes the stalking ground of a brutal and ruthless murderer...

The Corpse's Tale (Detective Trevor #3.5): One morning the vicar finds Anna's naked, battered body in the churchyard and Dai is convicted after Anna's blood-stained earring is found in his pocket...

Black Daffodil (Detective Trevor #4): Detective Trevor Joseph has his work cut out with the advent of a new welsh synthetically produced drug - black daffodil and it's impact on the criminal fraternities operating in and around Cardiff bay and the welsh valleys...

A Well-Deserved Murder (Detective Trevor #5): Sergeant Peter Collins' cousin, journalist and photographer, Alan Piper, is living next door to the neighbours from Hell...

Destruction Of Evidence (Detective Trevor #6): No evidence remained on the bodies of Alun Pitcher, a well-liked, wealthy, careful and cautious businessman, and his family after they'd been wrapped in brown paper and string, doused in petrol and ignited. The fires had destroyed any evidence, or so the pathologist and the local police believed...
